intro: Commelina canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf commelina, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue-violet flowers and hairy, silver-gray leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils. It has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties.
